credential.description: Credential defines a particular credential, and where it should be placed in the invocation image

description.description: A user-friendly description of this credential

env.description: The environment variable name, such as MY_VALUE, into which the credential value is stored

path.description: The path inside of the invocation image where credentials will be mounted

required.description: Indicates whether this credential must be supplied. By default, credentials are optional.

output.description: A value that is produced by running an invocation image

applyTo.description: An optional exhaustive list of actions producing this output

definition.description: The name of a definition that describes the schema structure of this output

description.description: A user-friendly description of this output

sensitive.description: Indicates where this output's value is sensitive and should not be logged.

parameter.description: A parameter that can be passed into the invocation image

definition.description: The name of a definition that describes the schema structure of this parameter

description.description: A user-friendly description of this output

env.description: The environment variable name, such as MY_VALUE, in which the parameter value is stored

path.description: The path inside of the invocation image where parameter data is mounted

sensitive.description: Indicates where this parameter's value is sensitive and should not be logged.

credentials.description: Credentials to be injected into the invocation image

invocationImage.description: The name of the container image to tag the invocation image with when it is built

tag.description: The tag to use when the bundle is published to an OCI registry

outputs.description: Values that are produced by executing the invocation image

parameters.description: Parameters that can be injected into the invocation image

dependencies.description: Dependent bundles that must be executed with the bundle

version.description: The version of the bundle, uses semver

dockerfile.description: The relative path to a Dockerfile to use as a template during porter build
